body_html:
@soumith There are some older libpython3.5m.so* files but I don't use them since moving to 3.6 .
I built Python 3.6 from source and installed it to a directory in my home directory. Maybe that's why the .so file doesn't exist?

I decided to build Python from source because Anaconda lagged for a couple weeks before updating their distribution, and I wanted an optimized build with the latest GCC. Anaconda uses a very old GCC for some reason.
